sub_topic: Probability of a certain weather event occurring
message_1: A weather forecaster predicts a 70% chance of rain on Saturday and 60% chance of rain on Sunday. What is the probability that it will rain on both days?
message_2:
To find the probability of two independent events both occurring, you can multiply the probabilities of each event. In this case, the probability of rain on Saturday is 70% (0.7) and the probability of rain on Sunday is 60% (0.6).

So, the probability of it raining on both days is:

0.7 (Saturday) * 0.6 (Sunday) = 0.42

Therefore, there is a 42% chance that it will rain on both days.
